description:
An array of data points for the series. For the map series type, points can be given in the following ways:

  1. An array of numerical values. In this case, the numerical values will be interpreted as value options. Example:

    data: [0, 5, 3, 5]

  2. An array of arrays with 2 values. In this case, the values correspond to [hc-key, value]. Example:

        data: [
        ['us-ny', 0],
        ['us-mi', 5],
        ['us-tx', 3],
        ['us-ak', 5]
    ]

  3. An array of objects with named values. The following snippet shows only a few settings, see the complete options set below. If the total number of data points exceeds the series' turboThreshold, this option is not available.

        data: [{
        value: 6,
        name: "Point2",
        color: "#00FF00"
    }, {
        value: 6,
        name: "Point1",
        color: "#FF00FF"
    }]

children.name: color
children.description: Individual color for the point. By default the color is either used to denote the value, or pulled from the global colors array.

children.name: dataLabels
children.description: Individual data label for each point. The options are the same as the ones for plotOptions.series.dataLabels.

samples.name: Disable data labels for individual areas

children.name: drilldown
children.description: The id of a series in the drilldown.series array to use for a drilldown for this point.

children.name: id
children.description: An id for the point. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the point object through chart.get().

children.name: labelrank
children.description: When data labels are laid out on a map, Highmaps runs a simplified algorithm to detect collision. When two labels collide, the one with the lowest rank is hidden. By default the rank is computed from the area.

children.name: middleX
children.description: The relative mid point of an area, used to place the data label. Ranges from 0 to 1. When mapData is used, middleX can be defined there.

children.name: middleY
children.description: The relative mid point of an area, used to place the data label. Ranges from 0 to 1. When mapData is used, middleY can be defined there.

children.name: name
children.description: The name of the point as shown in the legend, tooltip, dataLabel etc.

children.name: path
children.description:
For map and mapline series types, the SVG path for the shape. For compatibily with old IE, not all SVG path definitions are supported, but M, L and C operators are safe.

To achieve a better separation between the structure and the data, it is recommended to use mapData to define that paths instead of defining them on the data points themselves.

children.name: value
children.description: The numeric value of the data point.
